other_tests.findings: Histology of tumor showed a diffuse infiltrate of lymphocytes in dermis and subcutis with moderate epidermotropism. The infiltrate consisted of small-to-medium-sized, pleomorphic lymphocytes and eosinophils.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the culture period, the percentage of tumor cells increased and then decreased, while CD8+ cells propagated, indicating they had cytotoxic activity against the malignant T cells.

other_tests.findings: CD4+ cancer cells were determined to be CD3–CD7–, comprising 27.3% of total lymphocytes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No significant changes over time are specified, but repeated tests showed varying percentages of CD4+CD7– and CD3–CD4+ cells.

other_tests.findings: Normal cellularity with no invasion of atypical cells.
Approximately 30% lymphocytes exhibited a relatively large, irregularly shaped nucleus without prominent nucleoli or azurophilic intracytoplasmic granules.
Tumor infiltrating lymphocytes showed CD4+ and CD20+ populations with high infiltrate, including CD3–CD4+ tumor cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The percentage of CD3–CD4+ tumor cells increased in culture but decreased later, while the number of CD8+ cells increased.
